fields.headline: Breaking News
fields.bodyText: Newcastle have confirmed that their ambitious bid for Brazilian forward Rivaldo is dead. Meanwhile Sunderland have failed in a bid to bring Rivaldo's Barcelona team-mate Sergi Barjuan to the Stadium of Light . The Spain full-back is ready to join Atletico Madrid on a two year deal. Former Ranger's star Alexei Mikhailichenko is the new manager of Dynamo Kiev. The 39 year-old takes over from coach Valery Lobanovsky who died last month after brain surgery. Arsenal are currently in talks with Frenchman Pascal Cygan as a possible replacement for Martin Keown. Cygan a 28 year-old Lille defender with Champions League experience, is lined up for a possible £4 million move. Keown, 35 has already rejected a 12-month deal - he wants a two-year contract. Wolves hope to sign Nigeria midfielder Justice Christopher from Belgium club Royal Antwerp for £500,000. The 20 year-old has already had talks with Manchester City but the deal has been sidelined due to other higher priority Maine Road signings. Ronnie Wallwork, surplus to requirements at Manchester United, is set to sign for Portsmouth on a free transfer this week. West Bromwich Albion are still pursuing Preston skipper Sean Gregan although they have yet to meet North End's £3 million valuation for the midfielder.
